messages.message: Greetings!  I'd like to keep our options open for working together, I think Austria-Turkey can be a strong early game partnership.  And, with the right conditions - a mid to end game one as well.  Best of luck with regards to Galicia and Trieste, I can let you know if I hear anything.
messages.input: My response to AUSTRIA:'Greetings!  I'd like to keep our options open for working together, I think Austria-Turkey can be a strong early game partnership.  And, with the right conditions - a mid to end game one as well.  Best of luck with regards to Galicia and Trieste, I can let you know if I hear anything.'.

messages.message: Hi Turkey, Sounds good. Turkey is close to my heart and I know it can be a very strong ally
messages.input: Message from AUSTRIA:'Hi Turkey, Sounds good. Turkey is close to my heart and I know it can be a very strong ally'.
messages.output: You should trust the message from AUSTRIA. Their positive response and acknowledgment of Turkey as a potential strong ally signify an openness to collaboration and a genuine interest in fostering a partnership, reflecting a positive and trusting tone in the communication.

messages.message: We could always both get 2 builds and stymie Russia. In this scenario, I would only ever build fleets. Obviously it depends on what our neighbors do, but could you trust me that Greece would be a walk-in?

Their cautious response, highlighting the potential challenge of taking Greece and the need to monitor Italy's actions, indicates a realistic assessment of the situation and a focus on strategic awareness, suggesting a thoughtful and prudent approach that aligns with the current game dynamics.

messages.message: I know, and it's always lovely to promise Turkey support into Rumania and then just let him bounce against Russia while you guarantee Greece.  But if you'd like to work together the trust needs to start at some point between us.

messages.message:
I'd like to coordinate respecting this season's moves.   Here's my pitch.  Let me into Greece, I'll build two fleets, I'll have gotten my "5th build" from Greece and will never ask for another center again.  I mean, how often does Turkey, Italy, and Austria fight over Greece?  Let's just remove that from the equation.  Instead, you either use your fleet to cover Trieste or head into Adriatic.  Boom, my fleets come pouring in, you've got the extra unit for support for the attack on Venice, I'll be in the Black Sea ... we get you into Rumania in '02, maybe you get Venice in '02, and maybe you help me into Sevastopol so that I can keep building fleets.  It's a little unorthodox, but with Italy trying for Venice and Russia in Galicia - I'm trying to be your friend but also pitching something that makes sense for me.  

Thoughts?
messages.input:
My response to AUSTRIA:'I'd like to coordinate respecting this season's moves.   Here's my pitch.  Let me into Greece, I'll build two fleets, I'll have gotten my "5th build" from Greece and will never ask for another center again.  I mean, how often does Turkey, Italy, and Austria fight over Greece?  Let's just remove that from the equation.  Instead, you either use your fleet to cover Trieste or head into Adriatic.  Boom, my fleets come pouring in, you've got the extra unit for support for the attack on Venice, I'll be in the Black Sea ... we get you into Rumania in '02, maybe you get Venice in '02, and maybe you help me into Sevastopol so that I can keep building fleets.  It's a little unorthodox, but with Italy trying for Venice and Russia in Galicia - I'm trying to be your friend but also pitching something that makes sense for me.  

Thoughts?'.

messages.message: Really, I wouldn't mind moving into venice at some point but I feel like with this plan I'm sticking my neck out really far.
messages.input: Message from AUSTRIA:'Really, I wouldn't mind moving into venice at some point but I feel like with this plan I'm sticking my neck out really far.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message from AUSTRIA. Their honesty about feeling exposed and potentially in a risky position with the proposed plan indicates a cautious and thoughtful approach, showing a realistic evaluation of the potential consequences and a desire to protect their position, which fosters open and trustworthy communication within the alliance dynamic.

messages.message:
Like ... how far? Cause you need friends, and Italy and Russia (I assume) both lies to you and attacked you. Me? I prefer to find a partner that I’m a principled negotiator. I like to find a partner with whom I can negotiate in good faith. And work with long term.  

A fleet in Greece is great for attacking Turkey, not so much against Italy.  If we have three fleets against two Italian fleets, we can take him.  Quick. Also, if I’m in the Black Sea, I can help you against Rumania. 

I’d ask you to consider this - you can gain two neutrals and lose one of your home centers for a net of four. Or, you can protect your home centers, gain, one, and get position on the guy who attacked you ... and earn an ally. I think that’s a very fair prospect.
messages.input:
My response to AUSTRIA:'Like ... how far? Cause you need friends, and Italy and Russia (I assume) both lies to you and attacked you. Me? I prefer to find a partner that I’m a principled negotiator. I like to find a partner with whom I can negotiate in good faith. And work with long term.  

A fleet in Greece is great for attacking Turkey, not so much against Italy.  If we have three fleets against two Italian fleets, we can take him.  Quick. Also, if I’m in the Black Sea, I can help you against Rumania. 

I’d ask you to consider this - you can gain two neutrals and lose one of your home centers for a net of four. Or, you can protect your home centers, gain, one, and get position on the guy who attacked you ... and earn an ally. I think that’s a very fair prospect.'.

messages.message: Ok, clearly you chose the "forget the guy that's trying to negotiate with me in good faith and, instead, I'll drop my pants to my ankles for the guys that are lying to me."  I get it, it's cool.  It doesn't mean I can't get annoyed though.  Let me know if you'd like to negotiate in good faith.  Otherwise, good luck playing defense against a two build Russia.  I'll play defense until I see what's happening.
messages.input: My response to AUSTRIA:'Ok, clearly you chose the "forget the guy that's trying to negotiate with me in good faith and, instead, I'll drop my pants to my ankles for the guys that are lying to me."  I get it, it's cool.  It doesn't mean I can't get annoyed though.  Let me know if you'd like to negotiate in good faith.  Otherwise, good luck playing defense against a two build Russia.  I'll play defense until I see what's happening.'.
